TrainingDetails.Title: Taxonomy Component
TrainingDetails.Abstract: Taxonomy Components are found on various pages. The name taxonomy will not always describe this component on your page. Please refer to the tutorial and the pages that reference this component so see if you need to understand this tutorial.
TrainingDetails.BodyCopy:
The Taxonomy Navigation element, similar to regular navigations, creates data sets by pulling in page references based on taxonomical terms applied to pages in the site.

The Collapse button shows a sub-set of taxonomy attributes.

The Expand button shows the complete set of taxonomy attributes.

The Pick button launches the Pick a Category dialog. This dialog is used to select a category used to create a data set of pages.

The Pick button commits the selected category to the Taxonomy Navigation element.

The Cancel button closes the Pick a Category dialog without populating the Taxonomy Navigation element.

Name – displays the name of the taxonomical category associated with the element.
Path – displays the path to the selected category in the taxonomy hierarchy.
Include Pages – includes, when enabled, the category hierarchy and their associated pages. The Taxonomy navigation only includes the taxonomy hierarchy when this option is disabled.
Depth – defines how deep into the taxonomy hierarchy based on the selected start node selected in the Pick a Category dialog.
Filter Schemas – filters out page date set pulled in by taxonomy navigation based on Page Schema.
Filter Ancestor Pages – filters out pages outside of the scope of the category hierarchy.
Exports - allows for the entry of an associated attribute to be pulled along with the image into the current page. (also known as local export)

Name - specifies the name of the attribute to be exported with the page to which the element links.

Value - specifies the value of the attribute to be exported with the page to which the element links.

Existing Exports can be removed or additional Exports can be added by selecting the minus/plus buttons respectively. Notice that Exports consist of a Name/Value pair.
